Articles.ArticleTitle: Funding Change: How Retail Gets SMAC with SG&A
Articles.ArticleCaption: For retailers, investing in social, mobile, analytics and cloud technologies have gone from “nice to have” to “survival of the fittest.” Amid stalled growth, low margins and aggressive online competition, here's how traditional retailers can do just that, without getting in over their heads.

Articles.ArticleTitle: How the Internet of Things Will Overcome a Lack of Standards
Articles.ArticleCaption: Many languages and protocols are competing for prominence in the world of ambient computing. But don't wait for universal agreement—instead, standardization will occur layer by layer, held together by a framework.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Twelve Ways SMAC Can Save Hotels, Agents and Airlines
Articles.ArticleCaption: Travel and hospitality is a cut‑throat and competitive business. Amid consistent signs of widespread comeback, here's how individual hotels, travel agents and airlines can use social, mobile, analytics and cloud technologies and win.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Consumer Trust: Six Things Banks Must Do To Regain It
Articles.ArticleCaption: Amid wavering consumer confidence as a result of the "Great Recession," widespread hacks and stiff competition from online banks, here's what traditional banks can do to rebuild trust in the digital era.

Articles.ArticleTitle: From Feel-Good to Profits: How to Build and Leverage Workforce Diversity
Articles.ArticleCaption: Diversity is more than just the right thing to do. It's how companies can gain greater perspective, more innovation and ultimately better balance sheets. Here are six tips to help you get there.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Innovation vs. Efficiency: Which Lever Should Business Pull First?
Articles.ArticleCaption: Balancing business efficiency with innovation can be overwhelming but to thrive in today's global marketplace, companies must simultaneously do both to stay relevant and competitive.

Articles.ArticleTitle: The Future of Process Work: Creating Value With SMAC
Articles.ArticleCaption: Companies and shared service centers that fail to modernize their process work with SMAC technologies put their relevance at risk. Here's how to avoid that fate.

Articles.ArticleTitle: The Future of Telcos: Five Things to Know
Articles.ArticleCaption: For telecom companies, fancy digital support tools are still secondary, but they'll soon be the future. Here's what to do until then, according to recent Cognizant research.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Asian Private Banks' Digital Odyssey: How to Embrace Digital Transformation
Articles.ArticleCaption: Wealthy investors in Asia are digitally savvy, perhaps more so than those in other geographies. This makes it imperative for private banks in Asia to apply digital technologies to stay current with their clients' needs and desires. To contend with margin pressures and the growing competition from start-ups offering low-cost advisory services, Asia's private banks need to embrace digital to the core.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Eight Ways Retailers Can Avoid Digital Theft
Articles.ArticleCaption: What went wrong at Target, Home Depot, Sony and other victims of widespread security breaches and how can concerned retailers ensure their names don't end up in negative headlines? Our security expert Beth Musumeci explains the stakes and outlines your checklist.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Bye-Bye Plastic: How New Digital Payment Mechanisms Will Forever Change Shopping
Articles.ArticleCaption: For consumers and retailers, the future of contactless payments is now. Here's what executives can focus on today to ready their businesses.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Digital Success: Six Ways Retail Banks Can Find It
Articles.ArticleCaption: Despite their best efforts, traditional banks have a lot of catching up to do online; here are six ways they can get with the binary program.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Enabling Aftermarket Services as a Growth Driver for Manufacturers
Articles.ArticleCaption: By embracing SMAC technologies and focusing on service excellence, manufacturers can improve customer experience, create cross-selling and upselling opportunities and build lasting competitive advantage.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Drones: Four Ways Insurance Might Benefit
Articles.ArticleCaption: Drones have changed the way we see the world. And with their increased accessibility and affordability, they're capable of changing how insurance assesses risk, processes claims, optimizes manpower and reduces fraud.

Articles.ArticleTitle: The Way to a True End-to-End Digital Enterprise
Articles.ArticleCaption: Digital tools and technologies are propelling enterprises along the highway to transformative business value. The projected numbers range from $2.61 trillion generated annually through analytics to a cumulative 4.6 billion pounds in healthcare over 2011–17 in the UK alone. The estimated growth of global IP Internet traffic of 1.4 zettabytes by 2017 and a 50 billion connected things in 2020 are signposts of the truly connected enterprise of the future.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Future of IT Support: "So Long, Help Desk. Hello, Service Desk!"
Articles.ArticleCaption: The Internet of Things is poised to impact the help desk, just as BYOD and millennial workers did before it.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Travel Planning 2020: The Journey Toward Market Prosperity
Articles.ArticleCaption: By harnessing Code Halo thinking, travel and hospitality companies can transform their business models by offering an automated and customized trip planning experience, ushering in a new era for the travel industry.

Articles.ArticleTitle: A Race to Support Real-Time Mobility
Articles.ArticleCaption: As companies race to leverage real-time mobility or are dragged along by the tsunami of mobile devices and the data they generate, ensuring an optimal mobile experience for customers is top-of-mind for organizations.

Articles.ArticleTitle: The Significance of Real-Time Mobile Infrastructure
Articles.ArticleCaption: The proliferation of mobile devices and consumers' ever-increasing reliance on them is generating a virtual gold mine of data. Companies that are not panning for this gold risk being left behind in the race for revenue, customer loyalty and brand perception.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Car Rental Experience Survey 2014
Articles.ArticleCaption: For car rental companies, success is predicated on several factors. Our survey of 600 Cognizant associates across geographies indicates that they consider everything from mobile booking to the availability of USB ports in a rental car when deciding which provider to go with. The car rental company's loyalty program and the chances of an upgrade are major factors also influencing their decisions.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Gamifying Business to Drive Employee Engagement and Performance
Articles.ArticleCaption: It is a truth—not universally acknowledged—that between the star performers and the tail-end of the bell curve, dwell swathes of employees who only go through the motions at their jobs. According to some estimates, these disengaged employees cost the economy a whopping $550 billion annually.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Putting the Experience in Digital Customer Experience
Articles.ArticleCaption: As we enter the digital era, most business leaders understand that the "digital customer experience" is the key to engaging with customers and growing revenues. However, according to our recent research, the vast majority of businesses have a long way to go when it comes to getting it right.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Margins Take Center Stage
Articles.ArticleCaption: The impending margin provisions, though come with a host of challenges, promise sustainable success for firms that refine internal operations and rewire their strategy.

Articles.ArticleTitle: A Systematic Approach to Optimizing Collateral
Articles.ArticleCaption: By eliminating IT silos and creating a centralized collateral management system, you can achieve sizeable savings and a sustainable competitive edge. Here's how.

Articles.ArticleTitle: The Last Word: The Journey to 2020
Articles.ArticleCaption: The transition to fully digital business will be agonizingly slow and fraught with difficult decisions. Leaders that embrace IT merchandising, brand management, service management, Professional Engineering and analytics will lead the way in the coming decade.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Client Commentary: Retail Banking in a Code Halo World
Articles.ArticleCaption:
By leveraging data and analytics, Key Bank can better understand customer preferences and behaviors and deliver tailored offers, services and solutions.
Retail bankers are redefining convenience in high-stakes bids for customers. Let's face it — customer expectations have changed dramatically in just the past decade. It's no longer enough to offer banking via the Web, mobile device or app. Such services are mere table stakes.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Collateral Demand: US$11 Trillion Opportunity
Articles.ArticleCaption: As new Basel III norms, margin requirements and growing risk aversion, drive demand for high-quality collateral, there are ways to optimize this new currency in today's financial market.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Wealth Management in the Age of Social Media
Articles.ArticleCaption: People of all ages and demographics routinely turn to social media for advice and feedback on everything from appliances and service providers to dating, relationships and investments. Not to be left out, high net worth individuals are increasingly relying on social media for advice, even on issues as critical as wealth management.

Articles.ArticleTitle: The Future of IT: Making IT Your Organization's Code Halo Hero
Articles.ArticleCaption: CIOs and their teams can deliver on the promise of digital business transformation by serving up qualitative insights gleaned from thick data, rich in business insight and foresight.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Application Program Management: Software Development in the World of Code Halos
Articles.ArticleCaption: By taking advantage of the Code Halos spawned by programmers, business partners and tools across the Agile lifecycle management process, IT organizations can better manage application development performance, delivering software that is more closely tied to business objectives.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Information Architecture: Trolling in the Data Lake? Get Yourself a Fish-Finder

Articles.ArticleCaption: With predictive analytics, consumer brands create new value with consumers — and drive growth for their organizations today and tomorrow.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Digital Banking: Get Ready to Meet Your Customers
Articles.ArticleCaption: New data modeling and predictive analytics techniques are emerging to help banks create insightful digital strategies that map to their business objectives and strengthen customer relationships.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Digitizing Business Process: Why Smart Hands and Machines Will Power the Second Industrial Age
Articles.ArticleCaption: Whether your organization completely digitizes its business processes or takes a one-off approach, advances in foundational information technology, process automation and analytics, as well as machine intelligence, will unleash the potential for more productive and innovative ways of working.

Articles.ArticleTitle: The First Word: Signposts to a True End-to-End Digital Enterprise
Articles.ArticleCaption: As digital tools and technologies are embedded at the core of the business, the future of work looks more connected and data-driven than ever before.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Healthcare Consumerism: The Journey toward Transformation
Articles.ArticleCaption: Healthcare consumers increasingly expect payers to deliver value, service and experiences on a par with those they receive from the best online retailers. As we've examined in this series, taking three steps will help payers respond to consumerism. First, by Understanding the level of consumer expectations and their drivers, payers can then conduct a thorough Assessment of the gaps between what customers expect and what payers can deliver. These insights are critical for Step 3, Transforming the enterprise to be customer-driven.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Healthcare Consumerism: Assessing Consumerism Capabilities
Articles.ArticleCaption: As we've discussed in this series, health consumers seek payers that deliver a level of value, service and experience which matches what they receive from the best online retailers. Further, retail health consumers are increasingly empowered to spend their health premium dollars on payers of their choice. Payers responding effectively to consumerism's forces will have an advantage in attracting today's health consumer.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Healthcare Consumerism: Understanding Its Drivers
Articles.ArticleCaption: Empowered by healthcare reform and the freedom to spend their insurance premium dollars on payers' choice through health exchanges, consumers want better products, higher quality service and a better overall experience with payers.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Employee Wellness: Two Parts Perspiration, One Part Persistence
Articles.ArticleCaption: Lower levels of fitness and consequent health issues among people old and young is a serious and widespread problem for organizations across industries. Many companies have responded with scattershot efforts that often begin with the inauguration of new gym facilities and the provisioning of healthy food choices in their cafeterias. While nice first steps, these initiatives have not made much of a dent in expanding obesity rates and related health challenges.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Healthcare Consumerism: The Rise of the Empowered Healthcare Consumer
Articles.ArticleCaption: Healthcare consumers are gaining control over how—and with whom—they spend their healthcare dollars.

Articles.ArticleTitle: The Future of Work: A Practitioner's Perspective
Articles.ArticleCaption: You can learn a lot by studying the future of work for two years. Our research is your gain.

Articles.ArticleTitle: The Future of Marketplace Lending: Survey Says...
Articles.ArticleCaption: To cash in on peer-to-peer lending, retail and institutional lenders must improve their understanding of borrower choices and preferences and broaden their offerings beyond fast credit, student loans, home improvement and small business advances.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Capitalizing on the New Virtual Workplace

Articles.ArticleTitle: The Supply Chain is Dead: Long Live the Value Web

Articles.ArticleCaption: When properly used, enterprise social networking can speed decision-making, encourage collaboration and hasten response to market changes.

Articles.ArticleCaption: This isn't your grandfather's help desk. Here's how Fortune 500 companies can boost modern service desk productivity by as much as 20%, including higher employee satisfaction, faster fixes, better service and reduced costs.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Quality Savings: How Banks, Insurers, and Healthcare Can Smartly Modernize Work
Articles.ArticleCaption: Redesigning processes for cost savings is one thing—a good thing. But forward-thinking companies—including banks, insurers, and healthcare—are innovating as they modernize work processes.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Perfect Order Revisited: 9 Things Manufacturers and Retailers Need to Know
Articles.ArticleCaption: Modern manufacturers and retailers take heart: The elusive Perfect Order Index is within reach for anyone willing to rethink, reinvent, and rewire their "value web".

Articles.ArticleCaption: Cost savings are no longer enough. Here's how forward-thinking manufacturers and retailers are turning their supply chains into value webs to achieve innovative productivity gains.

Articles.ArticleCaption: To benefit from the improved housing market, lenders must comply with new regulations, automate their controls, and better serve aspiring home owners.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Why Enterprises are Embracing 'Everything as a Service'
Articles.ArticleCaption: A corollary of the mass movement to the cloud is the growth of "as-a-service" solutions. The flexibility of the commercial model and the shift of capital cost to operating cost are the most obvious benefits. Other key advantages are the ability to flex service delivery — up or down — in anticipation of changed market conditions and/or user requirements, the immediacy of access to functional innovations and revisions and perhaps most importantly, the overall acceleration of time-to-value.

Articles.ArticleTitle: The Fluid Core: Openly Networked and Transparently Open
Articles.ArticleCaption: As organizations move from production-focused to hybrid production-and-services frameworks, mobile and cloud computing are enabling seamless services across channels and devices—compelling them to infuse new skills, new tools, new management models and fresh faces into the business.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Decomposing the Internet of things: A $14.4 Trillion Opportunity
Articles.ArticleCaption: The Internet of Things (IoT) is turning out to be bigger than the Internet itself. And with size comes the promise of improved asset utilization, process efficiency, productivity, cost savings and of course, revenues.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Finders, Keepers: How to Claim and Retain Modern Human Capital
Articles.ArticleCaption: The traditional talent acquisition process can be revitalized by applying SMAC Stack technologies to conduct pre-assessment surveys, social sourcing, and attrition analysis

Articles.ArticleTitle: Discretionary Insurance: Seven ways to Social Media Success
Articles.ArticleCaption: Here's how insurance and retirement agents can "youth-anize" themselves on social media to reach the next-generation of policyholders without embarrassing themselves.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Creating Elastic Digital Architectures - Part II
Articles.ArticleCaption: In part I of the two-part series on creating elastic architectures, we covered in detail the four key questions companies must resolve to translate flexible IT service delivery into competitive advantage. Articles.ArticleCaption: Social, mobile, analytics and cloud technologies — the SMAC Stack — are transforming business, enabling organizations to infuse more "elasticity" in their structures.

Articles.ArticleCaption: In the big data age, it takes continuous learning to find insights and multidimensional customer profiles to stay relevant.

Articles.ArticleCaption: An enterprise transformation fabric — combining methodology, tools, services and best practices — can help organizations derive optimum business value from the cloud.

Articles.ArticleCaption: By following our five-step plan, media and entertainment companies can initiate and complete the transformation change necessary to survive in today's dynamic digital marketplace.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Segment-Based Strategies for Mobile Banking
Articles.ArticleCaption: Banks must apply their consumer segmentation smarts gained from years of successful cross-selling and customer-acquisition to advance mobile service adoption and differentiation. Here's how.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Business Analytics in Europe: The new science of “meaning-making” emerges…
Articles.ArticleCaption: Big Data is big. So big that it tends to overshadow what's really important: 'meaning-making'. The ever growing, never-ending avalanche of data is of no use unless companies can derive insights that grow revenue and reduce costs. Business analytics may not always excavate the right insights from the masses of data available. That's where the new science of meaning-making comes in.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Separating Signal from Noise: How Meaning Makers Conquer Big Data
Articles.ArticleCaption: Smart application of advanced business analytics are not only driving growth but separating winning companies from the pack, our research shows.

Articles.ArticleTitle: Using Advanced Analytics to Combat P&C Claims Fraud
Articles.ArticleCaption: Advanced analytics — text, social media, link and geospatial analysis — can help P&C insurers combat sophisticated claims frauds, reduce related losses, condense claims cycle and improve customer satisfaction.

Articles.ArticleCaption: As discussed in the previous installment, the Crossroads Model takes companies that embrace Code Halo™ thinking through a predictable five-step model that rewards winners with market relevance and growth and helps avoid Extinction Events. Articles.ArticleCaption: There is no escaping the bring your own device trend, but organizations need to chart a middle path to strike a balance between employee freedom and corporate control over technology.
